page.title: 06Local Surgery
page.content: There has been a surgery in the village since 1927, before the National Health Service. The Practice extends over a radius of 8 miles. There are 2 doctors, district nurses, health visitors and midwives employed by the Area Health Authority. The Practice uses 7 hospitals in Newark, Nottingham and Lincoln. All patients belong to the N.H.S. Surgery hours are 9.00am. to 10.00am. and 4.30pm. to 6.00pm. Monday to Friday. Saturday 9.30am to 10.00am. for emergencies. The surgery is a dispensing practice, so patients do not have to travel to Newark for a chemist.
